The DPPH free radical scavenging activity was determined with the method of Liyana-Pathiranan and Shahidi [ 27]. Here, 1 ml of 0.135 mM 2,2-diphenyl-1-picrylhydrazyl radical (DPPH) prepared in methanol was mixed with 1.0 ml of the essential oil, BHT and ascorbic acid at concentrations ranging from 0.025 to 0.5 mg/ml. The reaction mixture was then vortexed thoroughly and left in the dark at room temperature for 30 min. The absorbance of the mixture was measured using spectrophotometer at 517 nm. The actual decrease in absorbance was measured against that of the control. All tests and analysis were done in triplicates. The scavenging ability of the essential oil was then calculated using Eq. (4):
(4)
DPPH scavenging activity
( % )
=

where; Abs control is the absorbance of DPPH + methanol; Abs sample is the absorbance of DPPH radical + sample (sample or standard).
